author: Staff Reporter
text:
The prime accused in the V. Gokulraj murder case, S. Yuvaraj, being brought to the court in Namakkal on Thursday.—Photo: E. Lakshmi Narayanan

Chief Judicial Magistrate S. Malarmathy on Thursday asked the CB-CID to produce all the 17 accused in Gokulraj murder in the court on March 3 so that charge sheets could be served to them.

When the case came up for hearing, the court was informed that 16 accused were present, including S. Yuvaraj, while one accused Chandrasekar (44) could not be present in the court as he had undergone an eye surgery.

The Magistrate noted that this was the second time that all the accused were not present to receive the charge sheets and warned that arrest warrant would be issued to the accused if they failed to appear in the court on March 3.

She posted the hearing for March 3 and asked the CB-CID to ensure that all 17 accused were present on that day

Earlier, when Yuvaraj was brought to the court from Vellore Central Prison at 2.40 pm, his supporters raised slogans hailing him. Six others who were detained under the Goondas Act and lodged in Salem Central Prison were also produced in the court. Of the ten accused, who are on bail, nine were present on the court premises. Yuvaraj’s wife Suveetha and over 50 supporters of Theeran Chinnamalai Gounder Peravai were present.

The CB-CID had on January 7 filed 725-page charge sheet naming 17 persons as accused in the Dalit youth murder case after his body was found on tracks near Pallipalayam on June 24, 2015. Though charge sheets were to be served to all the accused on February 16, police could not provide security on that day and the magistrate posted the hearing to February 25.
title: Charge sheet in Gokulraj murder case to be served on March 3
